verses.plain: A good name is better than precious ointment; and the day of death than the day of one’s birth.

tokens.t: A good name
better than precious ointment; and the day of death than the day of one’s birth.

verses.plain: ¶ It is better to go to the house of mourning, than to go to the house of feasting: for that is the end of all men; and the living will lay it to his heart.

tokens.t: better to go to the house of mourning, than to go to the house of feasting: for that
the end of all men; and the living will lay
to his heart.

verses.plain: Sorrow is better than laughter: for by the sadness of the countenance the heart is made better.

tokens.t: Sorrow
better than laughter: for by the sadness of the countenance the heart is made better.

verses.plain: The heart of the wise is in the house of mourning; but the heart of fools is in the house of mirth.

tokens.t: The heart of the wise
in the house of mourning; but the heart of fools
in the house of mirth.

verses.plain: It is better to hear the rebuke of the wise, than for a man to hear the song of fools.

tokens.t: better to hear the rebuke of the wise, than for a man to hear the song of fools.

verses.plain: For as the crackling of thorns under a pot, so is the laughter of the fool: this also is vanity.

tokens.t: For as the crackling of thorns under a pot, so
the laughter of the fool: this also
vanity.

verses.plain: ¶ Surely oppression maketh a wise man mad; and a gift destroyeth the heart.

tokens.t: ¶ Surely oppression maketh a wise man mad; and a gift destroyeth the heart.

verses.plain: Better is the end of a thing than the beginning thereof: and the patient in spirit is better than the proud in spirit.

tokens.t: Better
the end of a thing than the beginning thereof:
the patient in spirit
better than the proud in spirit.

verses.plain: Be not hasty in thy spirit to be angry: for anger resteth in the bosom of fools.

tokens.t: Be not hasty in thy spirit to be angry: for anger resteth in the bosom of fools.

verses.plain: Say not thou, What is the cause that the former days were better than these? for thou dost not enquire wisely concerning this.

tokens.t: Say not thou, What is
that the former days were better than these? for thou dost not enquire wisely concerning this.

verses.plain: ¶ Wisdom is good with an inheritance: and by it there is profit to them that see the sun.

tokens.t: ¶ Wisdom
good with an inheritance: and
profit to them that see the sun.

verses.plain: For wisdom is a defence, and money is a defence: but the excellency of knowledge is, that wisdom giveth life to them that have it.

tokens.t: For wisdom
a defence,
money
a defence: but the excellency of knowledge
wisdom giveth life to them that have it.

verses.plain: Consider the work of God: for who can make that straight, which he hath made crooked?

tokens.t: Consider the work of God: for who can make
straight, which he hath made crooked?

verses.plain: In the day of prosperity be joyful, but in the day of adversity consider: God also hath set the one over against the other, to the end that man should find nothing after him.

tokens.t: In the day of prosperity be joyful, but in the day of adversity consider: God also hath set the one over against the other, to the end that man should find nothing after him.

verses.plain: All things have I seen in the days of my vanity: there is a just man that perisheth in his righteousness, and there is a wicked man that prolongeth his life in his wickedness.

tokens.t: All
have I seen in the days of my vanity: there is a just
that perisheth in his righteousness, and there is a wicked
that prolongeth
in his wickedness.

verses.plain: Be not righteous over much; neither make thyself over wise: why shouldest thou destroy thyself?

tokens.t: Be not righteous over much; neither make thyself over wise: why shouldest thou destroy thyself?

verses.plain: Be not over much wicked, neither be thou foolish: why shouldest thou die before thy time?

tokens.t: Be not over much wicked, neither be thou foolish: why shouldest thou die before thy time?

verses.plain: It is good that thou shouldest take hold of this; yea, also from this withdraw not thine hand: for he that feareth God shall come forth of them all.

tokens.t: good that thou shouldest take hold of this; yea, also from this withdraw not thine hand: for he that feareth God shall come forth of them all.

verses.plain: Wisdom strengtheneth the wise more than ten mighty men which are in the city.

tokens.t: Wisdom strengtheneth the wise more than ten mighty
which are in the city.

verses.plain: For there is not a just man upon earth, that doeth good, and sinneth not.

tokens.t: For
not a just man upon earth, that doeth good, and sinneth not.

verses.plain: Also take no heed unto all words that are spoken; lest thou hear thy servant curse thee:

tokens.t: Also take no heed unto all words that are spoken; lest thou hear thy servant curse thee:

verses.plain: For oftentimes also thine own heart knoweth that thou thyself likewise hast cursed others.

tokens.t: For oftentimes also thine own heart knoweth that thou thyself likewise hast cursed others.

verses.plain: ¶ All this have I proved by wisdom: I said, I will be wise; but it was far from me.

tokens.t: ¶ All this have I proved by wisdom: I said, I will be wise; but it
far from me.

verses.plain: That which is far off, and exceeding deep, who can find it out?

tokens.t: That which is far off, and exceeding deep, who can find it out?

verses.plain: I applied mine heart to know, and to search, and to seek out wisdom, and the reason of things, and to know the wickedness of folly, even of foolishness and madness:

tokens.t: I applied mine heart to know, and to search, and to seek out wisdom, and the reason
, and to know the wickedness of folly, even of foolishness
madness:

verses.plain: And I find more bitter than death the woman, whose heart is snares and nets, and her hands as bands: whoso pleaseth God shall escape from her; but the sinner shall be taken by her.

tokens.t: And I find more bitter than death the woman, whose heart
snares and nets,
her hands
bands: whoso pleaseth God shall escape from her; but the sinner shall be taken by her.

verses.plain: Behold, this have I found, saith the preacher, counting one by one, to find out the account:

tokens.t: Behold, this have I found, saith the preacher,
one by one, to find out the account:

verses.plain: Which yet my soul seeketh, but I find not: one man among a thousand have I found; but a woman among all those have I not found.

tokens.t: Which yet my soul seeketh, but I find not: one man among a thousand have I found; but a woman among all those have I not found.

verses.plain: Lo, this only have I found, that God hath made man upright; but they have sought out many inventions.

tokens.t: Lo, this only have I found, that God hath made man upright; but they have sought out many inventions.

footnotes.text: good…: or, as good as an inheritance, yea, better too
before…: Heb. not in thy time?
take…: Heb. give not thine heart
I applied…: Heb. I and mine heart compassed
whoso…: Heb. he that is good before God
counting…: or, weighing one thing after another, to find out the reason
